alert.note: Alert for Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 25 at 9:08AM CDT until October 25 at 11:15AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR EASTERN TOM GREEN COUNTY... At 905 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing light to moderate rain across the warned area. Between 1.25 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. At the airport in San Angelo at 905 AM CDT, 1.76 inches has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Angelo, Christoval, Lake Nasworthy, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Knickerbocker, O.C. Fisher Reservoir, Tankersley, San Angelo State Park, Wall and Grape Creek. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... College Hills and Millbrook, Howard and Webster, Jackson From Knickerbocker to South Bryant, Southwest Blvd and Loop 306, 1500 Block of Spaulding, 300 block of North Archer, Huntington and Sunset, FM 2334 crossing Dry Lipan Creek, Huntington and Sunset and Sul Ross At Red Arroyo Crossing. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
